comment: Really nice
Dr Woodard was amazing! She made sure everyone actually knew the material, and cared about her students. Also, if you want to ask her for opportunities, don't be shy!

Dr. Woodard was a good professor overall. I had her for an online course and the course load is moderately heavy, but if you plan your work out it should be fine. Be prepared to study because tests are difficult! She gives lots of extra credit opportunities throughout the semester so take those. She usually responded to emails pretty quickly. Take!

All of her lectures are recorded online, there's a lot to do every week, including a weekly reflection, which is: question creation based on the lectures, read a text and answer questions, make a connection like a mind map or meme, or story. The tests are mildly difficult. If you do all of the other assignments, you should be fine.

Take your notes, review them, and you will do just fine! Lectures are engaging and you can tell she's passionate for her content. Expectations are clear and she gives great feedback on assignments. She also gives plenty of extra credit opportunities.

While this course is note-taking heavy, she is very good at keeping the lectures engaging. I've never had any issues getting in touch with her, she stays very organized, and gives great feedback on assignments. I cannot recommend this course and Dr. Woodard enough as this has been one of the greatest classes I have ever taken.

Took her for online summer class and probably only spent 1-2 hours on this class weekly. Weekly reflections take a little longer, but you only have to do 4. Lots of extra credit. She wants you to succeed. Watch the exam review videos before the midterm & final - they were both 20% each with camera + mic, but be ready & it'll be easy! Take her!!
I loved Dr.Woodard, one of the best professors I have taken! Really fair when it comes to grading and truly wants the best for you! Would %100 recommend you take her.

You'd think this class would be an easy pass given how well you do on the weekly works but the things that have a significant impact on your grades are super hard to ace. I got a C for my mid term grade even though I averaged 90% in all her quizzes because of the stupid map quiz
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Worst history professor I've ever had no joke I wouldn't wish her class on my worst enemy

TAKE!! Some of these ratings are not good and I have no idea why. By far the easiest history class I have taken! You only have to do 7 of the weekly reflections so some weeks all u have is a quiz (2 attempts). Her tests arent  easy, but are very easy to study and do well on. Virtual museums r also SO easy. did all my work for the  week in one day

I was 50/50 with this course. For it to be an online course it felt like it took up my entire day, yet the work was very easy. Each module had a quiz and 2 attempts. The answers were also in her PowerPoint. You had to do weekly reflections which felt a little extra as well as virtual museums. However, she was an easy grader and easy to access.

Great professor for online if you need to take a history course. Open note quiz and weekly reflections every week. Gives great study materials for midterm and final. Gives extra credit opportunities and puts a lot of effort into her lectures. Very caring and wants everyone to succeed in her class. Very well organized and clear deadlines. TAKE HER
It was hard to rate her as a professor, I feel like she present and honestly believes she's a really caring and flexible teacher but she was hands down one of my worst experiences
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Her class is planned out very well, however if you are not a good test taker she is not for you. All her weekly quizzes are open notes however her map/mini, midterm and final are all worth a significant amount of your grade and they require lockdown+webcam. The wording of her test make them very hard, her study guides are broad, no clear outline.

No textbook but ~1hr(ish) of pretty engaging lecture vids per chapter. Open quiz per chapter, lockdown midterm & final. Lots of extra credit. Put in pretty minimal effort and watch lectures/take notes and you should get an A. Overall a very chill summer course, I spend roughly 2 hours a week and have a 98% after midterm.

Weekly discussions on slideshows(she uploads them after class) and articles & weekly quizzes(2 attempts) & 2 exams(60-70 questions) & attendance/participation are both 10% instructions are straightforward and she gives you 5 extra credit opportunities and if you communicate she will help you but she will not accept late work
Prof Woodards course was fine. The work is straight forward. The only thing that was difficult was the midterm and test. The questions are worded confusingly and the tests are weighed heavily

lectures and tests are very straightforward. She gives you the information you need to know for the tests. She wants you to succeed and makes sure you know what information she will be testing you on. I don't like history but this class made it easy to understand and enjoyable to learn about. I wish she taught some of my other classes

Quizzes every week, midterm and final, and weekly reflections along with around two 20-25 minute lectures every week. She gave 5 extra credit opportunities which were great! There wasn't lots of reading. Pretty straightforward class. She gave study guides for the midterm and final; lets you know exactly what to study. Quizzes were open note. Take!

Dr. Woodard is a really great professor who cares about her students. She offers lots of extra credit opportunities to help your grade. There's a weekly quiz and discussion post that would only take you an hour to complete. Theres participation points that you can get in class or through discussion posts. Take her class if you have the chance to.

Professor Woodard is a decent professor. She is certainly not the best professor Ive ever had but shes not the worst. She gave us a fairly large amount of work this semester, some of which I felt was completely unnecessary. For example, each week there will be a weekly reflection that requires you to summarize the lectures and read more articles.

Dr. Woodard is one of the best online professors I have ever had. Her lectures are clear-cut, entertaining, and informative. As long as you listen to the lectures each week and take notes you'll do great on the tests. Dr. Woodard is very understanding and she really seems like she cares about each student and what she teaches!

I did well on everything (100s) and even did the extra credit assignments. Still wasnt good enough for an A because of her tests. Shes one of those that expects you to know everything about everything on the study guide. Plus she words every question weird. Makes it difficult to achieve an A. If you arent good at tests like me, stay away.

She is a wonderful teacher , she teaches to understand and takes her time to explain things thoroughly, she does give extra credit opportunities and attendance is mandatory but youre allowed 3 absences however attendance is only 10% of your overall grade
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Amazing lectures

comment: In this class, you are going to have to earn your grade. She is very nice and a good professor. I feel that if she fixes some little things she could be better. If you take this class be ready to write a lot of notes till the point your hands start cramping. Also, her quizzes/tests are worded kind of weird and she uses lockdown browser.
Dr. Woodard is a very good professor. She is willing to work with you as much as you need and is looking out for you and your grade.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Her class was asynchronous with weekly assignments and quizzes. She listens to student feedback and even changed the assignments to be easier halfway through the semester. Her powerpoints are thorough and most of her lectures aren't boring. Expect to do weekly discussions that switch between a small group or whole-class discussion.

She is super sweet but I also think because she is a younger professor she is not as laid back as some of the older college professors. All lectures are recorded and based off PowerPoints. She bases the test off the PowerPoints. If you study PowerPoints and watch the review sessions you will earn a A in this class.

She gives great opportunities for extra credit. Only cons is that she is not very accessible and rarely responds to emails. The workload can also be overwhelming, but she is a great teacher and you can tell she is passionate about what she does. Definetly expects too much from non history majors. Her class feels like my 4000 level classes.
If you miss a test you cant make it up. She says um way to manny times 68 times in a ten minute video for example (yes I counted).

Dr Woodard is an amazing professor! Im taking her online. There are weekly quizzes and discussion posts but she gives clear instructions so youll get 100 once you follow them. She has study guides for each test and she really wants you to do well. Sometimes all the assignments can feel like a lot but its do-able. Shes such a nice, quirky prof.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class--Gives good feedback

comment: To be honest I HATE history, but even for me, I love Prof. Woodards class. She is the most helpful professor Ive ever met. There are quizzes each week and three exams, all based on exactly what she taught. And she read everyones assignments and gave you positive comments based on your content. She is so sweet and you dont want to miss her.

Dr. Woodard is such a nice professor. She listens to her students feedback and makes according changes if needed. She breaks the content down weekly and also sends out reminders for due dates. Honestly if you just do the assignments correctly you should do well

I took Dr. Woodard during summer 2020 and she is an amazing professor! The class consisted of weekly essays that are not too difficult, several video lectures are broken up into 10 minutes each with that are easy to follow, and discussion board posts. As long as you do all the work on time you should be fine. Weekly quizzes and tests based on PP.

Dr. Woodard is honestly a gem at Kennesaw. She genuinely cares about each and every one of her students. Her tests aren't extremely difficult but you will need to actually study and attend lectures to succeed. She also gives plenty of fun extra credit opportunities. You seriously won't regret taking her class.

Fantastic professor. For the fist time in all my years of school, a history teacher made the material about more than just memorizing dates. Lectures are funny and engaging. If you have to take an entry-level history class take her, if you can.

Professor Woodard was a very good professor, however her tests were written very difficult and very specific. Attendance is not mandatory, but she does like to throw out pop quizzes so look out for that. Overall Good Professor!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: She is the nicest professor I have ever had, she's such a sweet lady. There is a lot of homework but it is SO easy and she gives a ton of extra credit. Study her study guides for the tests (info comes straight from her power points), and you'll be fine! Also, you can't miss more than 6 classes so come to class and participate to get a good grade!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Woodard relishes in complete and utter control. At times she teaches inaccurate material and for someone with a Ph.D., says, "I'm not sure" a lot. It's obvious she is uncomfortable lecturing about topics outside of her majors/minors. She is slightly passive aggressive and I would not recommend!
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: The difference between a good and great professor that both teach the material well is one who is passionate and cares. Dr. Woodard is one of them! Super clear grading criteria, has study guides, extra credit opportunities, but just make sure to do the discussion readings and participate. Downside is notebooks only and no electronics or laptops
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Cares about her students well being, but also a great professor. No electronics allowed during class, but extra credit for turning them in. 2 reading assignments a week, 3 exams including final. 3 absences allowed. Easy class to pass as long as you do the assignments, and participate. Plenty of extra credit as well.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: If only she had more history classes I would DEFINITELY take them! She makes class very fun even though there is a lot of participation. Her humor is nerdy but adorable. I have really enjoyed her as a professor because she really cares about what she does as a profession. She is simply AMAZING!
